name: Chef John's Russian Tea Cakes
author: Chef John
summary: As the old joke goes, these Russian tea cakes might not be Russian, but at least they're not cakes. No one knows exactly how these came to be known as Russian tea cakes but, nevertheless, they are quite delicious.
ingredients: 1 cup confectioners' sugar for dusting, or more as needed
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Arrange rack in center position of oven
Place butter, 1/3 cup packed powdered sugar, walnuts, salt, and vanilla in a bowl
Mix with your clean hands until the dough starts to clump up
Keep mixing by hand until all the flour and clumps of butter are evenly mixed into the dough and it can be easily formed into balls
Scoop out dough and roll by hand into uniformly round balls, just slightly larger than 1 inch
Place on a rimmed baking sheet lined with a silicone baking mat about 2 inches apart
Bake in preheated oven until lightly golden, 15 to 25 minutes depending on the size of the cookies
Let cool exactly 5 minutes then roll in remaining 1 cup confectioners' sugar
Let cookies cool completely and toss them again in the confectioners' sugar
